element.name: Fit for a Cache by Windsockers, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)

long-description.p: The cache is set in the grounds of Malahide Castle please note the opening and closing times of the park which are as follows:

November to January: 10.00am - 5.00pm
February to March 10.00am - 6.00pm
April 10.00am - 7.00pm
May 10.00am - 8.00pm
June to August 10.00am - 9.00pm
September 10.00am - 8.00pm
October 10.00am - 7.00pm
To find the cache you will need to collect the following information.

At the above location take note of how many sponsers are listed call this A
Take note of the total distance around the perimeter call this B
Take note of the number for the “stride Jumps” call this C
At this location take note of how many letters are in the name of this item call this D

At this location take note of how many words are in the name of the cottage E
How many letters are in the second word call this F
At this location take note of how many beams are here and the number of post GHI

The Cache is a Decon box.
Please take care and rehide the cache to prevent muggles from
discovering its location.

element.encoded-hints: I'm stumped where o where could it be?

ul.li:
2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by Alastair74
Found while spending the day in Dublin for the WWFM with Wildfowler TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by wildfowler
Found on a caching weekend around Dublin with Alastair74! TNLNSL TFTC

2010-05-08T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
The name of the cache made sense immediately when we arrived at the car park. The little cacher enjoyed the walk. We're fit now, thank you!. Got us searching for a while around GZ. Difficult to find the object in the hint once you open your eyes and you're surrounded by them.

2010-04-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fitzet
This was a great one to do with the kids as they loved running from one piece of equipment to the next. It would have been really quick except we spent about 45 minutes looking in completely the wrong place. When we actually had the coordinates right we found it in about, o, 5 minutes.
Out: Golfball and marble In: 2 marbles

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found this cache after a lovely walk around the park. It was a lovely sunny day & lots of people out. Maybe summer is coming. TFTC Toffee Man #294

wpt.name: GC20N90
wpt.desc: Fit for a Cache by Windsockers, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Fit for a Cache
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The Cache

The cache is set in the grounds of Malahide Castle please note the opening and closing times of the park which are as follows:

November to January: 10.00am - 5.00pm
February to March 10.00am - 6.00pm
April 10.00am - 7.00pm
May 10.00am - 8.00pm
June to August 10.00am - 9.00pm
September 10.00am - 8.00pm
October 10.00am - 7.00pm

To find the cache you will need to collect the following information.

Stage One

At the above location take note of how many sponsers are listed call this A
Take note of the total distance around the perimeter call this B
Take note of the number for the “stride Jumps” call this C

Stage Two

Goto N53 26.CC8 W6 10.2BA

At this location take note of how many letters are in the name of this item call this D

Stage Three

Goto N 53° 26.B1(A+1) W 006° 10.5D(D-B)

At this location take note of how many words are in the name of the cottage E
How many letters are in the second word call this F

Stage Four

Goto N 53° 26.B(B+F)(C+D) W 006° 10.ED(F+B)

At this location take note of how many beams are here and the number of post GHI

Final Location

Goto N 53° 26.E(I-H)F W 006° 10.(G-H)CI

The Cache is a Decon box.
Please take care and rehide the cache to prevent muggles from
discovering its location.







The Windsockers


Additional Waypoints

FN20N90 - GC20N90 Final
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S220N90 - GC20N90 Stage 2
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S320N90 - GC20N90 Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S420N90 - GC20N90 Stage 4
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: I'm stumped where o where could it be?

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Found while spending the day in Dublin for the WWFM with Wildfowler TFTC
Found on a caching weekend around Dublin with Alastair74! TNLNSL TFTC

The name of the cache made sense immediately when we arrived at the car park. The little cacher enjoyed the walk. We're fit now, thank you!. Got us searching for a while around GZ. Difficult to find the object in the hint once you open your eyes and you're surrounded by them.

This was a great one to do with the kids as they loved running from one piece of equipment to the next. It would have been really quick except we spent about 45 minutes looking in completely the wrong place. When we actually had the coordinates right we found it in about, o, 5 minutes.
Out: Golfball and marble In: 2 marbles
Found this cache after a lovely walk around the park. It was a lovely sunny day & lots of people out. Maybe summer is coming. TFTC Toffee Man #294
